page.title: 09SHIPBUILDING IN GOOLE
page.content: { Ship building}and ship repairs began shortly after the port of Goole was founded in 1826.The shipyard was originally owned by the Craggs family and was latterly part of British Shipbuilders. It was a real blow to this area which has a high unemployment level, when in March 1984, Goole Shipyard was {closed}with the loss of over 300 jobs. In September 1984, the yard was bought by Cochrane Shipbuilders of Selby. Later, in February 1985, it was announced that ships were once again to be built in Goole. This was followed by further{orders and it was hoped that the present workforce of over 50 would soon be increased.
